newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOL revises 96 net up to HUF22.7bln - report.
newsitem.headline: MOL revises 96 net up to HUF22.7bln - report.

text.p: Hungarian oil and gas company MOL has finalised its 1996 earnings report, revising its 1996 net income figure up by 0.5 billion forints to 22.7 billion forints, the Hungarian news agency MTI said on Sunday.
MTI said that the figures were audited, consolidated and calculated according to the International Accounting Standard, and were comparative with a 1995 net income figure of 1.2 billion forints.
MTI added that MOL's final audited unconsolidated after-tax profit, calculated according to the Hungarian Accounting Standard, was 13.9 billion forints, up by 0.4 billion from a preliminary figure.
The state privatisation agency APV will begin a roadshow on Monday for the sale of at least 12.5 percent of MOL's shares to international institutional investors.
The roadshow will finish on May 2, and APV will price and allocate the shares on May 6.
The preliminary 1996 figures, released in February, surprised analysts. They said the profit, boosted mainly by a turnaround in MOL's gas business, was unexpectedly high.
